TopicTitle: A parts / mods used list maker for .craft files... Anybody tried to make one?

Articles.Content:
Has anyone previously attempted to do this? I have been downloading .craft files and a few of them are flagged as containing parts I don't have the mods for or just flat out crash the game (have no idea why, previous version maybe?). So I made an experimental Python 3 script to see if I could make a list of the parts used in one of my own creations.


>>> f = open('Science Jet II.craft','r')
>>> for eachline in f:
	if eachline.find('part =') != -1:
		print(eachline)

Which yielded this list:


part = Mark1Cockpit_4275323052

	part = science.module_4275322986

	part = SmallGearBay_4275322840

	part = B9.Cockpit.MK1.Body.Fuel.5m_4275322664

	part = B9.Cockpit.MK1.Body.Fuel.5m_4275322628

	part = B9.Cockpit.MK1.Body.Fuel.5m_4275322592

	part = JetEngine_4275322556

	part = B9.Aero.Intake.CLR_4275322476

	part = B9.Aero.Intake.CLR_4275322444

	part = JetEngine_4275322412

	part = JetEngine_4275322332

	part = airScoop_4275322252

	part = airScoop_4275322220

	part = airScoop_4275322188

	part = airScoop_4275322156

	part = R8winglet_4275322124

	part = R8winglet_4275322086

	part = B9.Aero.Wing.SW.Wingtip.2x7m_4275322048

	part = B9.Aero.Wing.SW.Wingtip.2x7m_4275321998

	part = R8winglet_4275321948

	part = R8winglet_4275321910

	part = SmallGearBay_4275321872

	part = SmallGearBay_4275321696

	part = parachuteRadial_4275321520

	part = parachuteRadial_4275321474

	part = parachuteRadial_4275321428

	part = parachuteRadial_4275321382

	part = GooExperiment_4275321336

	part = GooExperiment_4275321292

	part = KWRadBattSmallS_4275321248

	part = KWRadBattSmallS_4275321212

	part = batteryPack_4275321176

	part = batteryPack_4275321140

	part = sensorThermometer_4275314288

	part = sensorThermometer_4275313612

	part = sensorThermometer_4275313140

part = sensorThermometer_4275312462

part = sensorThermometer_4275312062

part = sensorThermometer_4275311528

part = sensorThermometer_4275311080

It worked! And I do have B9 Aerospace and KW Rocketry loaded. For this to truly work, I'm hoping some sort of part naming convention has been adopted in the modding community that follows closely what the makers of B9 and KW have done by embedding their mod's name or at least partial name or obvious abbreviation into the part's name.

What are your thoughts, ideas, improvements? Am I wasting my time reinventing someone else's wheel?

EDIT: I found a website that can do much of what I wanted: http://mykspcareer.com/resources/analyzer/

Edited March 29, 2014 by neamerjell
Found new info

Huh, cool idea. I haven't been downloading .craft files, so this hasn't come up for me. But I can see how it might be useful.

The good news is that the save files are very straightforward, so as you've done here, the code can be very simple.

I have a similar idea and in Python too , fortunately, or not, KSP Mod Admin 1.3.11 have something which do this in a very good and useful way, craft are in red if they contains parts for mods you don't have.
You could scan every single part for their name and see which folder what part belongs in.

I have a similar idea and in Python too , fortunately, or not, KSP Mod Admin 1.3.11 have something which do this in a very good and useful way, craft are in red if they contains parts for mods you don't have.

KSP 0.23 does this in the load window with a message, but my goal was not only to know if I was missing mods, but which ones.

http://mykspcareer.com/resources/analyzer/

This website does a pretty good job, but even it didn't recognize some .craft files' parts, so its database of parts and mods they belong to is not exhaustive. But once I found this site, I pretty much realized I was indeed reinventing someone else's wheel.

It would be an interesting experiment to see if a local program could be written that interfaces with this website, however the site itself has a rudimentary "human check" in place, so bandwidth may be quite limited. So the creator obviously didn't intend for scripts constantly query the server.

I have a similar idea and in Python too , fortunately, or not, KSP Mod Admin 1.3.11 have something which do this in a very good and useful way, craft are in red if they contains parts for mods you don't have.

Thank you for the suggestion. I recently downloaded this program and it really is the wheel I almost reinvented...
